title.narrative: Toward Sustainable Agribusiness Clusters through Learning in Entrepreneurship

description.narrative: 2SCALE is an incubator and accelerator program that manages a portfolio of public private partnerships (PPPs) for inclusive business in agri food sectors and industries. 2SCALE provides a range of support services to Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs), who act as lead firms. Together with producer organizations, agribusiness clusters and other grass root actors, we enable them to produce, transform and supply quality food products to local, national and regional end-user markets, including BoP consumers, while at the same time developing fair and sustainable relations with smallholder farmers and other local entrepreneurs. Partnerships have also been developed with Dutch companies doing business in Africa with inclusive business agendas.

The program focuses on establishing agribusiness clusters around business champions such as entrepreneurial producer organizations or local SMEs that trade or process farmer produce and want to build commercially viable strategies in African food industries through: • sustainable sourcing, based on mutually beneficial relations with smallholder farmers, and • by serving local and regional Base-of-the-Pyramid (BoP) markets. These companies are the drivers of inclusive business; they are called inclusive business champions. The program supports these champions to develop BoP products and markets. The program intends to set up and support partnership and business models with significant potential to attract and employ the youth, to engage and empower women, and to improve food and nutrition security, both at grassroots level and at the consumer end of the value chain. Specific goals have been formulated, related to the FNS result framework of the Dutch Ministry in regards the number of BoP consumers, farmers, MSMEs (including POs) and across these groups specific targets for women and youth, of which the terms of inclusion or terms of access to food will be improved: • Improve access to nutritious food in 40 BoP markets, and for at least one million BoP consumers, through inclusion in value chains and local-end markets. • Empower, improve productivity and net incomes of 750,000 farmers (50% women, 40% youth) through inclusion in agribusiness clusters and (regional) value chains. • Support 250 small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs, of which at least 125 female-led) to improve their inclusive business activities; and to develop leadership in industry platforms / networks. • Strengthen capacity of 5,000 micro, small and medium-sized enterprises (MSMEs, of which at least 2,500 are female-led and 1,000 are young entrepreneurs) through inclusion in value chains4.[1] • Create 20,000 additional non-farming jobs (of which at least 10,000 for women and 8,000 for youth).

The program intends to set up and support 60 partnership and sustainable business models with significant potential to attract and employ the youth, to engage and empower women, and to improve food and nutrition security. Both at grassroots level, and at the consumer end of the value chain. The following outlines the target groups for inclusive business: • BoP consumers (specifically related to malnutrition). • Smallholder farmers (specifically for women and youth). • MSMEs (micro-, small- and medium-sized enterprises, specifically for MSMEs led by women / young entrepreneurs), including small-scale processors at proximity of target smallholder farmers. • Employees of all companies involved in core and supplier value chains, including grassroots / other MSMEs and LSEs (large-scale enterprises) (specifically for women and young employees).

title.narrative: Measuring Universal Impact Indicators: Guide for 2SCALE partnership facilitators

description.narrative: This document guides the 2SCALE team in how to collect data that enables the program to report on its contributions to the impact domains and the program to learn from measurements showing progress and direction.

title.narrative: Smallholder farmers have improved agricultural productivity levels and have better terms of inclusion (value chains/ markets)

description.narrative: Smallholder farmer here refers to agricultural producer managing a landholding size within a country specific range or below a generic average of 2 hectares or less

title.narrative: This indicator will be measured as the volume of produce sourced by business champion AND/OR the volume of input commercially sold by the business champion of its partners.
Rural communities are resilient to the implications of climate change

The indicator smallholder farmers accessing services or procuring inputs related to eco-efficient or climate-smart practices. Here the adoption of practices by smallholder farmers to denote # of hectares covered thru' such eco-efficient or climate smart practices.
BOP consumers have access to affordable and nutritious food products

BoP-Bottom of the Pyramid consumer: consumers with an estimated daily income below 8.44 PPP (international dollar). The indicator will be measured in Volumes (in tonnes) of the product(s) commercially sold and accessible to the consumers in the targeted locations.
